attributes.action: Introduce laws to stop the sale of knives from easily viewable display cases.
attributes.background: With the increase of knife attacks across the UK. We are asking for tighter laws controlling the sale of knives from display cases. Knifes should be sold from covered cabinets. You can't buy cigarettes from open displays due to the impact on health. We should treat the sale of knives the same way.
attributes.additional_details: Open and easily viewable cases that display knives are showing them as glamour items. They show knives and advertise them as exciting accessible items. Take a store in Sheffield that is displaying knives like the USMC Ka-bar. This is clearly a military knife. If knives are not on display and are not easily viewed, accessible or advertised in a glamorous ways. People that use them genuine reasons will have to ask for them. This allows for retailers to question their legitimate use and purpose.

attributes.action: Put pressure on the Chinese Government over the treatment of Uyghur Muslims
attributes.background:
Reports have suggested that the chinese government has been placing Uyghur Muslims in “re-education” camps, forcing them to drink alcohol and consume pork, both against the Islamic faith. 

These camps are echoes of previous ethnic cleansing and there needs to be ample pressure on China.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/china-re-education-muslims-ramadan-xinjiang-eat-pork-alcohol-communist-xi-jinping-a8357966.html%3famp

attributes.action: Open a coroner's inquest for every stillborn baby.
attributes.background: In 2011 a midwife signed by baby off to receive a stillborn certificate. 7 years I have fought and in March this year the coroner found that my baby was NOT stillborn. He survived for 1hr10minutes, he suffered a neonatal death and should have received a Birth and Death certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
How many more families have/are going through this? How many babies could there be that have been wrongfully categorised as Stillborn?
We need to change the law so that every single baby who the midwives/doctors believe to be stillborn receives a coroner's inquest. If this was the case back in 2011 it would have saved our family 7 years of heartache. 
Now our son's birth will be registered and he will forever be on our family tree, he will never be forgotten, what every baby deserves.

attributes.action: The immediate expulsion of all Israeli diplomats and sanctions against Israel.
attributes.background: The atrocities taking place in Gaza needs to be brought to the attention of the government. Israel needs to be held accountable for its actions against innocent people.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting age to 16
attributes.background:
At 16, UK citizens can do the following:
Get married with consent
Can own property
Can get a job
Can join the army
Pay taxes
Join a trade union
Many 16 year-olds feel that as they contribute to society and the country, they deserve their voices heard as to its political direction and leader.

attributes.action: Reduce knife and gun crime with deterrent sentences
attributes.background:
10 yrs minimum for carrying a knife 
20 yrs minimum for using a knife 

20yrs minimum for carrying a gun
40yrs minimum for using a gun

All without parole.
attributes.additional_details:
The current sentences that the judiciary are handing out are obviously not deterrent enough

Act now !

Save lives !

attributes.action: Clearing pavements of ice should not bring legal liability if someone then falls
attributes.background: The law is such that persons clearing public pavements of snow and ice, e.g. outside their house or business, are then liable for civil action in the event someone slips, whereas not clearing the ice means you are not responsible, and thus can't be sued. The result is more dangerous pavements.
attributes.additional_details:
While the principle of "liability where actions have been taken" is sound, in this case it results in a less beneficial outcome. 
Government advice is "you're unlikely to be sued", but that is hardly encouraging. https://www.gov.uk/clear-snow-road-path-cycleway

There will always be a grey area where the use of inappropriate methods (like warm water) should be admissible when determining blame, but in the absence of such proof, the intent to clear ice in itself should not bring liability.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ask for someone’s previous salary.
attributes.background:
The salary negotiation process, and specifically the gender salary gap is directly affected by a company knowing a person’s previous salary. 

The salary band for the role should be defined for the role, and based on the responsibility and scope.

This shouldn’t be based on the previous salary.
attributes.additional_details: Previous salary should be treated like date of birth or age, gender, disability or trade union membership.

attributes.action: Investigate the links between MPs and foreign intelligence services
attributes.background: In our age of democracy it is important that all our representatives in Parliament do not act in a way that can be seen to be against parliamentary and democratic standards.

attributes.action: Abolish workplace parking charges for NHS staff
attributes.background: These people dedicate their lives to helping the sick and vulnerable and are often poorly paid . It seems extremely unfair that they should be charged for attending work.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all cyclists to wear reflective jackets in the dark.
attributes.background: I frequently drive in the dark during the Autumn/Winter months and have noticed how frequently I pass cyclists that are not wearing anything reflective. To ensure the safety of cyclists and of drivers, I feel that it should be compulsory for them to wear a reflective jacket in the dark.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the cyclists I pass in the Autumn/Winter months wear dark clothing and rely on a small bicycle light to make them noticeable to drivers. It is not safe and it is not helpful. I feel that these cyclists are putting their own lives at risk by not wearing reflective clothing and by not doing so, also putting drivers at risk. I feel quite strongly about this, mostly because the reflective jackets are not expensive, so there is no excuse not to wear one.

attributes.action: Provide increase support for parents with disabilities and their children
attributes.background: Children who have parents with disabilities are only able to access free school meals, the nursery grant for 2 year olds and pupil premium if they are on income related benefits. This means many working parents with a disabled partner are left better off leaving work to care for their families.
attributes.additional_details: Where a parent is on PIP they are considered “incapacitated” for childcare purposes in tax credit legislation and for extended hours nursery provision for 3 year olds. This does not extend to pupil premium, 2 year old nursery places or to free school meals - even if the incapacitated parent is unable to prepare a meal for themselves. Where one parent works and the other is considered incapacitated, children should receive these in order for the working parent to remain in work.

attributes.action: Cut National Citizens Service funding and apply funds to schools and the NHS
attributes.background: In 2017 NCS recieved £180.5 million from the government and has proceeded to spend it on extravagant advertisements instead of the actual service. This money could be better used by schools which constantly face budget cuts and the NHS which is in desperate need of more funding.

attributes.action: Allow RSPCA to seize animals that they believe to be in danger
attributes.background:
The police have to be there for the RSPCA to seize an animal, because of this it is a lot of time wasted for the Police force. 

RSPCA are educated on these situations and should be allowed to go ahead and take any animal they believe to be in danger without the authorities.
attributes.additional_details: Not being able to take an animal that is in danger can cause harm to the animal and sometimes this becomes fatal and there will be a court case, which also is a lot of wasted money when it could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pencil sharpeners with easy release blades.
attributes.background: Many young adults these days with the pressures of school, friends and social media struggle at times and sadly turn to self-harm. As a parent you can hide all the sharp cutting items in your house only to find your child using the removable blade from a pencil sharpener.
attributes.additional_details: How is that an under 18 can’t go and buy a knife, razor or anything with a blade but can go and buy a pencil sharpener which has a removable blade? There’s even a video on YouTube that shows you how to remove it although it is only a tiny screw holding it in so it’s not rocket science! To ban all under 18s buying one is not perceivable but I do believe they could be manufactured differently such as having a non-tamper screw. If the Government bans those where the blade is easy to release, industry will follow with a safer product. Something has to be done.

attributes.action: Insist the Government give a 50% discount for Council Tax single occupants
attributes.background: At the moment single occupants get a 25% reduction in their Council Tax which is most unfair. In houses with more than one person there are more like to be dual or more incomes, so there the reduction should be 50% to single occupant earners or pensioners as they are pay 25% more on one income.

attributes.action: Launch a National Consultation on Reducing Plastic Usage
attributes.background: Blue Planet 2 has started a national talk on reducing plastic usage, we need to start reducing the hidden plastics in retailers, e.g. Plastic cutlery, wrapping around magazines, DVDs, CDs, Cigarettes etc. A national consultation is needed with companies to reduce the usage of plastics.

attributes.action: Legislate to give wheelchair users priority access to bus wheelchair spaces
attributes.background:
Wheelchair users do not have lawful priority over other passengers for access to designated wheelchair spaces/bays on public buses.

There have been frequent and media reported cases of such persons being able to travel as other passengers refused to move. Legislation is required to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike passenger railway systems, persons in wheelchairs do not have priority access to wheelchair spaces provided on buses, despite this being the only safe space for a person in a wheelchair to travel.

Despite the recent Supreme Court case brought by Doug Paulley, bus drivers have no legal power to force other passengers to move, and can still only request that they do so.

This is detrimental to any person in a wheelchair and has a significant impact on travel.

attributes.action: Toughen UK knife laws, raise the age to buy knives over 3 inches to 21 years old
attributes.background: Knife crime is an epidemic in the UK, surely raising the age to buy knives would shrink the culture our country has normalised. It would mean teenagers can no longer buy knives to use as weapons. Knife crime was 6x more likely to occur in 2017 than gun crime. I wonder why?
attributes.additional_details: London has a huge issue with knife and gang related crime, minimising the amount of people able to buy knives must surely impact this. Nearly 13000 recorded incidents of knife crime in Just London last year, with less knives on the street in the wrong hands surely this statistic would also plummet.

attributes.action: The immigration amnesty of Grenfell survivors should be indefinitely extended
attributes.background: ‘Foreign’ survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire were granted a temporary 12-month immigration “amnesty” for them to stay in the U.K. regardless of their immigration status but may still face deportation after that.

attributes.action: No to automatic opt in for organ donation
attributes.background: UK resident will be automatically opted in for organ donation and will have the choice to opt out after the Bill is passed.  This law should not be passed because it is our body and it is our human right to opt in ourselves if we want to.
attributes.additional_details: Our body is not the property of the government to give this consent on our behalf. It is a  violation of our human rights. People are aware of organ donation and can choose to opt in if they wish to opt in. People may not be able to opt out before their death as death can be sudden. People may not be aware of this law so it will be unethical to opt them in as they wouldn't know they have to opt out. We refuse this law should be passed where peoole are automatically registered to organ donation.

attributes.action: Freedom of Information Act should apply to any company working for the Govt.
attributes.background: There are many Private sector companies that have accepted a contract from either Local or Central Government. They are receiving tax payers money, yet are providing no transparency to the public. Its time for these companies to be included in the the current FOI.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to prevent farm animals from moving freely for long periods
attributes.background: Many farm animals are prevented from moving by tethering to stanchions in sheds, tie stalls and "zero grazing" systems for dairy cattle - and rarely or never letting them outside. Pigs are given no space to move in tiny "sow stalls" ; chickens by so many being in one shed they can barely move.
attributes.additional_details:
For information on zero grazing systems, tie stalls and tethering by the neck unable to move in dairy farming see this link
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
On "sow stalls" for pigs leaving them unable to move at all
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235118/The-life-of-Pigs.pdf
Chickens farmed for meat
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235306/The-life-of-Broiler-chickens.pdf
Chickens farmed for eggs
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235024/The-life-of-laying-hens.pdf

attributes.action: Create an age limit and a license for all dog owners
attributes.background: Hoping to change the law so that anyone who wants to own a dog has to be 21 plus and also have to buy a license for dogs deemed 'bad breeds' such as bull mastiffs, bull dogs, staffies to stop idiotic people from having 'easy' access to these dogs.
attributes.additional_details: In may 2017 a family pet was mauled by 3 big dogs, described as bull mastiff, pit bull and staffordshire bull terrier dogs, the family pet was a king charles cavalier which stood no chance against these 3 massive dogs, but somehow the dog survived. The owner of the dogs is a young lad who has been training them to rip apart cats and lets them run loose when going for walks. 28th Jan 2018 they attacked a Labrador and killed it, again the owner just walked off with the dogs.

attributes.action: Allow Petitions Calling for No Confidence in Ministers on petition.parliament.uk
attributes.background: Call government/parliament to allow petitions calling for a vote of No Confidence in Ministers/MPs due to the recent decision by the petitions committee not to accept/allow them. The decision should be made by the British public who politicians, parliament & the petitions committee are answerable to
attributes.additional_details: We live in a democratic country where the general public must have a voice that can be heard and taken into account.  Ministers and MPs must be accountable to the general public who should have the right to submit a petition for debate which people across the U.K. can support.  Some previous petitions calling for No Confidence have had over 100,000 signatures however only a few people in the petitions committee have decided not to allow them in the future

attributes.action: Send a force to free people that are being enslaved in Libya
attributes.background: Are we the generation to be remembered for allowing slavery back? People are being enslaved in Libya in broad daylight and the World knows. It is unacceptable that only lip service has been paid to such a violation of human life. We have been complicit in these evil acts by our failure to act.
attributes.additional_details:
Libya migrant 'slave market' footage sparks outrage - BBC News - http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-42038451

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://amp.timeinc.net/time/5042560/libya-slave-trade&ved=0ahUKEwi3-Zyv0ZbYAhVQ_KQKHZ7CAIgQFggkMAA&usg=AOvVaw1OKyfqviElPGxqFMjSAiJR&ampcf=1

attributes.action: Compulsory compensation by local authorities.
attributes.background: Following the introduction of the ULEZ coming into action in April 2019, millions of Londoners are being deprived of their valued possessions by the decision of the local authorities.
attributes.additional_details: Any implementation of new / change of regulation, imposed by any authority in the UK triggering the immediate devaluation of personal possessions of its constituents (e.g. the immediate depreciation of personal and commercial vehicles following the introduction of ULEZ) should be bound by law to a compulsory compensatory pay equal to the true and actual loss suffered to every individual or entity affected and deprived of the financial value of its possessions in the public interest.

attributes.action: Raise the definition of a child in the Mental Health Act to from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Parents of 16 year old children held under the Mental Health Act cannot find out how they’re coping. The staff are unable to share any information on the children. Children under 18 are unable to keep themselves safe, so 16 to 18 year olds should be classified as children under the Act.

attributes.action: Take the UK out of the EU's Customs Union in 2021 as promised.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned are deeply unhappy that the Government has decided to keep the UK in the Customs Union beyond the Brexit transition/implementation period.
attributes.additional_details: We further reject the use of the Irish Border "problem" as the reason for this decision (the so-called "backstop") and therefore call upon the British Government to immediately reverse this decision and keep its promise to the British people that the UK will be leaving the Customs Union at the end of the transition/implementation period in 2021.

attributes.action: New law so that mobile suppliers cannot change the terms of contracts
attributes.background: I believe contracts should be honoured. As a consumer I do not have the right to change the terms of the contract after a purchase. I want a new law to state that mobile phone companies cannot change the terms of a contract without the consent of the other party to the contract.
attributes.additional_details: In March, I renewed my SIM-only contract because it offered free roaming in Turkey at no additional cost. Within a few weeks they contacted me to say that free roaming in Turkey is no longer included in my contract and would cost £6 a day to use my phone there. My wife also took out a contract a couple of weeks after me with the same belief that we could use our phones in Turkey for no fee.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Make banks directly responsible for contacting those who have been missold PPI
attributes.background: Banks and credit card companies place the onus on individuals to seek out whether they have had PPI, yet they hold this information and it is readily available to them.  The responsibility should rest with the companies who have missold to make all efforts to trace their victims and make recompense.
attributes.additional_details: Banks hold the information in their systems and files as to who had PPI.  Those most likely to need the compensation are possibly least able to pursue a claim.  Why should individuals have to possibly employ companies who gain financially from their loss or try to remember historical financial contracts?  Now the government has put a deadline for claiming.  Before that deadline banks should make every reasonable effort to trace those who have had PPI making it easier for them to pursue a claim.

attributes.action: Reduce the deadline date of the tampon tax from 2022 to 2019!
attributes.background: The Treasury vowed to axe the outdated tax on all sanitary products in January 2016. Currently, the Tampon Tax is set to be abolished by 2022 at the earliest. Help to put an end to the marginalisation of issues of women by demanding a zero tax rate for sanitary products.
attributes.additional_details:
Women are expected to spend £900 in tax for their periods in their lifetime. Menstruation should not be labelled as a luxury.

Together, with the abolishment of the tampon tax, we can get rid of the taboo around menstruation.

attributes.action: Put retirement age back to 60 for females and 60 for men.
attributes.background: I am 58 years old. Working with all sorts of conditions: COPD; Glucoma; 2 bad discs; Arthritis. To try and get time off to see a doctor is almost impossible. Getting up is a struggle. But I am not entitled to disability as I can dress wash and feed myself. Everyday is a struggle.

attributes.action: Strip the £32m funding from Oxfam & share to the rest of the charities in the UK
attributes.background: There is 185000 Charities registered in the UK and the vast the majority rely on meagre amounts compared to this £32m to teach Oxfam a lesson who already make £90m a year from it's shops, this could significantly help the smaller independent charities up and down the entire country
attributes.additional_details: There are more than 185,000 registered charities in England and Wales. The number is rising by 5,000 a year. As you read this, another charity will be created somewhere in the country. The charity commission lists 620 cancer charities alone and more than 200 charities working with homeless people just in London. - The Guardian

attributes.action: Scrap the points on speeding offences
attributes.background:
Government should scrap the points for speeding offences only keep fines if any one is speeding they should get fine no points 
This government should scrap the points on speeding offences

attributes.action: Include teaching on online safety to children in all Primary & Secondary schools
attributes.background: Children and young people are increasingly vulnerable to online bullying, abuse and exploitation, as well as serious crime networks.This needs to be acknowledged in schools, and children need to be empowered to better protect themselves and their peers from online abuse.

attributes.action: No foreign aid to Pakistan for supporting terrorism.
attributes.background: Pakistan soil has become a training camp for terrorists. The government of Pakistan have been supporting terrorists; UK foreign aid therefore goes to terrorists. Government must immediately stop all foreign aid to Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details: On one hand, they show that they have taken action to tackle terrorism; on the other hand, they support terrorism for their own gain. Granting foreign aid to Pakistan seems as if we are financially supporting the terrorists. Many terrorist-related events in Afghanistan, India and other countries are initiated in Pakistan. Recent bomb blasts in Afghanistan killed hundreds of innocent people.

attributes.action: Stop once and for all unsolicited SMS fraud in the UK
attributes.background: Shady companies are sending fraudulent unsolicited premium rate SMS text messages to mobile phone owners in the UK. These cost recipients up to £4.50 a message often resulting in huge bills to the victim as the fraud is likely to go unnoticed for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details:
Find a detailed description of the issue here:

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3580058/Thousands-hit-4-50-time-scam-Customers-facing-bills-hundreds-pounds-texts-advertising-gaming-services-pornographic-content.html

This petition posits it should be a legal requirement for phone carriers to:

Not allow these services be activated on a customer’s account unless they have explicitly requested so (e.g. a representative of the carrier calls the customer to confirm activation of this service was indeed requested). If a carrier does not have this framework in place, they should not be allowed to operate premium SMS services at all.

attributes.action: Release the 2012 NHS reform risk Assessment.
attributes.background: In 2012, the Health Secretary vetoed the publication of the risk assessment relating to the changes introduced in the Health and Social Care Act. The Information Commissioner's office declared that in the circumstances this was unreasonable and requested they be released.
attributes.additional_details: This petition requests that said document is released in the name of transparency.  No law was implemented to allow the government to pursue its current restructuring of the NHS and a reorganisation was guaranteed to be "off the cards" by the prime minister.  The current government has no mandate to reorganise the NHS and create ACOs.  We request access to the risk assessment in order to see if this was predicted prior to the 2012 HaSCA and whether the current collapse of the NHS was preventable

attributes.action: Allow more people of non British Nationality/Citizenship join the British Army
attributes.background: I am not of British decent my dream would be to join the British Army as I have been living here in Scotland for 11 years and want to serve what i class as my country right now members of the Commonwealth and with British Citizenship can serve So me being Polish makes joining a real issue, Thanks.
attributes.additional_details: The last calls for Polish Citizens to be allowed to join the Forces was in 2008 but nothing came from so when i found out about this when i was doing me research I was really disappointed so i applied for a Citizenship but that also got knocked back making my dreams feel impossible to achieve so i would like peoples help in making my dreams come true and i'm sure many other people are having the same issue as me they love the country the live in but are not allowed to serve in its Armed Forces

attributes.action: Remove the no smoking ban from mental health hospitals
attributes.background: I recently stayed in a mental health hospital and was unable to smoke. This is almost a form of torture. For 5 days i was unable to go out or go to a smoking area. People have enough stress while in hospital, there should be a smoking area where people can go to at least once an hour

attributes.action: To make it law that all public places to have a defibrillator on site
attributes.background: On the 23rd a December I was at a non league football match, a spectator suffered a cardiac arrest. The club had a defibrillator on site and that saved the mans life.
attributes.additional_details: I was going make the petition about non league football grounds having a defibrillator, I have decided to make it all public places. For example every supermarket , football ground and shopping centre must have a defibrillator.

attributes.action: On four lane motorways, restrict HGV vehicles and coaches to lanes 1 and 2.
attributes.background: The country has spent billions in upgrading traditional motorways to four lane smart motorways, however all this investment is wasted as soon as you get three trucks trying to overtake each other at 55mph. Trucks should be limited to lanes 1 and 2 to allow faster travellers to go in lanes 3 and 4.

attributes.action: Outlaw an expiry date on Gift Vouchers.
attributes.background: I had a gift card from a well known resturant chain. When I redeemed the card I was shocked to find that the resturant refused to honour it saying it was out of date.

attributes.action: Ban Gambling Adverts Pre-Watershed
attributes.background:
This petition aims to get the government to introduce legislation to ban gambling adverts from being shown pre-watershed. 

Gambling is a huge problem in the UK, last year a Gambling Commission report finds more than 2 million people are addicted to gambling or at risk of developing a problem [1].
attributes.additional_details: [1] https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/aug/24/problem-gamblers-uk-gambling-commission-report

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Remove prescription fees for those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: From our experience, many people suffering with mental health issues need a number of prescriptions, which are expensive. In particular those with bipolar have difficulty managing their money - it’s part of the illness. Bipolar is life threatening - their prescription should be free.

attributes.action: Pay nursing students whilst on placement in University
attributes.background: Nursing students whilst in University work full time with the NHS. For some people, the money that they get from the NHS and their loan isn’t even enough to cover their rent and living costs.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of student nurses get depressed, anxiety and are over tired because they put so much hard work into their nursing degrees especially from all the placements including night shifts. A lot more get stressed because they physically can’t afford to live due to overpriced student housing and then money to live off for the whole year. There is also transport to think about for nurses going to placement. Student nurses feel like they’re ‘cheap labour’ for the NHS which is awful and upsetting.

attributes.action: Require hospitals to provide sufficient free staff parking for nurses
attributes.background: My friend, an amazing nurse, is forced to pay £24 per week to park at the hospital she works for. She only works 16hrs, yet a substantial percentage of her pay is used enabling her JUST to GO to work. Nurses are already ridiculously underpaid for their role in saving lives. How can this be fair?
attributes.additional_details: The NHS, particularly hospitals, are one of if not the busiest body of workers in the UK. Nurses work tirelessly 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to provide a service that treats over 1 million patients in just 36 hours. There is a critical shortage of nurses with 1 in 11 NHS posts currently unfilled. Nurses are important, and it makes no sense to charge them to be able to simply go into work. It’s unfair, its uneconomical, and it is clearly not helping in people staying within NHS employment.
